chapter.htmlHeader: Doses and titration of laxatives
chapter.htmlStringContent:
In general, start at the lowest dose and increase the dose every few days until one or two soft, formed stools are produced each day. Giving adequate fluids with laxatives may reduce the risk of dehydration.

  • Higher doses than the maximum licensed dose may often be needed to adequately treat constipation. If so, informed consent should be verbally obtained and documented.

Table 1. Recommended laxative doses.

LaxativeAgeSuggested start doseTitration schedule (recommended by NICE)License status

1–5 years Movicol® Paediatric PlainTwo sachets on day 1, then four sachets daily for 2 days, then six sachets daily for 2 days, then eight sachets daily. Treat until impaction resolvesOff-label duration and age. Licensed maximum of 7 days with this regimen
5–12 years Movicol® Paediatric PlainFour sachets on Day 1. Then increase in steps of two sachets daily to a maximum of 12 sachets daily. Treat until impaction resolvesOff-label duration. Licensed maximum of 7 days with this regimen
12–18 years Movicol®Four sachets on Day 1. Then increase in steps of two sachets daily to a maximum of eight sachets daily. Treat until impaction resolvesOff-label duration. Licensed maximum of 3 days with this regimen
